section.title: How to use Spot
section.p: You can’t ask Spot to do tricks until you after you invite him to a channel and authorize yourself as a Spot trainer.

section.title: Call Spot and make him do tricks

li.p: Launch Slack if you haven't already.
Go to a channel where you want to invite Spot.
Invite @spot like you would invite anyone else.
If this is the first time you’ve commanded him, Spot tells you:
Spot takes you out of Slack and to the ThoughtSpot application.
If you do this successfully, the application tells you:
Go back to Slack and ask Spot to list what he does by typing @spot help.
Spot can run a query directly that’s the 1. anything command.
Work your way from a pinboard to asking for a particular chart.

section.p: At this point, you should go onto explore your Spot’s talents on your own!

section.title: Frequently Asked Questions
section.p: Whenever possible, Spot answers questions for you directly in channel. Here, though, are some frequent questions owners ask.

section.title: Can I name my Spot whatever I want?
section.p: Sure. This is done by your administrator when the integration is created. Um, I guess the answer is really “ask your parents?”

section.title: Spot isn’t fetching what I want, why?
section.p: Spot can only fetch “toys” that are have the spot sticker. Your administrator should do this when he sets up ThoughtSpot.

section.title: My spot looks different, why is that?
section.p: The screenshots in this document were taken on desktop integration of Slack. If you are using mobile device, your interactions with Spot will look different.

section.title: How does Spot know you?
section.p: The first time you message Spot, it will send back a link which you can click to link your ThoughtSpot account to Slack account. After the accounts are linked, all charts you query from Spot will be tied to your permissions/authorization.

section.title: How to subscribe to charts posted to a channel?
section.p: Any chart retrieved using spot can be subscribed to, and can have any number of channel/user subscribers.

section.title: How do I get the list of Spot commands?
section.p: Messaging help to spot gives you a list of commands and how to use them.
